com.revature.controllers

Class BatchController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.revature.controllers.BatchController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/batches")
 @CrossOrigin
public class BatchController
extends Object
    BatchController takes care of handling our requests to /batches. It provides methods that can perform tasks like all batches, batch by number, batch by location, add batch, update batch and delete batch by id.
    Author:
    Adonis Cabreja

      • getBatches

        @GetMapping
public List<Batch> getBatches(@RequestParam(name="location",required=false)
                                           String location)
        HTTP GET method (/batches)
        Parameters:
        location - represents the batch location.
        Returns:
        A list of all the batches or batches by the location.

      • getBatchByNumber

        @GetMapping(value="/{number}")
public Batch getBatchByNumber(@PathVariable(value="number")
                                                              int number)
        HTTP GET method (/batches/{number})
        Parameters:
        number - represents the batch number.
        Returns:
        A batch that matches the number.

      • addBatch

        @PostMapping
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Batch> addBatch(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                             @Valid Batch batch)
        HTTP POST method (/batches)
        Parameters:
        batch - represents the new Batch object being sent.
        Returns:
        The newly created object with a 201 code.

public Batch updateBatch(@Valid @RequestBody

        HTTP PUT method (/batches)

      • deleteBatchByNumber

        @DeleteMapping(value="/{number}")
public String deleteBatchByNumber(@PathVariable(value="number")
                                                                     int number)
        HTTP DELETE method (/batches/{id})
        Parameters:
        number - represents the batch number.
        Returns:
        A string that says which batch was deleted.
